title: Works GREAT!
comment: I couldn't get my files transferred from my Galaxy S3 to my PC and still preserve the timestamp using Airdroid (which I needed because my USB phone port stopped working).  ...until I found this program.  Combined with FileZilla on my PC (set to 'Preserve timestamps of transferred files'), it did just what I wanted!  Thanks to the developers.  David

title: Great
comment: Simple and effective. Install and play

title: Smalll but complete.
comment: Replaces transfer of files by cable. No useless bells and whistles. Great tool. Many thanks to the depelopper.

title: A Great FTP Server
comment: Nautilus in Debian 7 connects well, via secure FTP, to my Galaxy Note II.

title: No MDTM support
comment: Unfortunately, it does not suport the MDTM command to set the proper modification date/time after copying files to the FTP server. This is essential in order for this program to be compatible with backup and sync utilities. Please consider adding this feature ASAP. Thanks!

title: Corrupts files
comment: Corrupts files during transfer on Galaxy S2. Both mpg and jpg.

title: Decent but flawed
comment: A nice concept, however I find that when uploading video files to my phone with this app, the video file in some way becomes corrupted and I am unable to either fast forward through the video or it does not play the entire file.  Just as a reference:  I have a Samsung Galaxy S3 which for whatever reason it was decided to remove UMS capability, therefore I must use the Kies app that creates an ad-hoc web server that allows me to connect to my phone to transfer files among other things.  I noticed that when I started using this FTP software to transfer my files, the video would exhibit the issues I described above.  These same videos play fine when using the Kies app to transfer them.  I'm not sure why but just a heads up in case anyone else is experiencing the same issue.

title: Τέλειο!
comment: Κάνει αυτό που πρέπει και το κάνει σωστά! Ελαφρύ, γρήγορο, μικρό και ελεύθερο λογισμικό! ;)

title: Best way to share files between devices
comment: Simple. Works. Quick. Using a combination of ES Explorer (on Android), this and FileZilla on PCs, I no longer need any cables to transfer files between my phone, tablet and PC. Awesome. Worthy of donation.

title: Excellent!
comment: Works great. Upgraded to paid app.

title: Good
comment: But doesn't support resuming uploads in most clients.  +1 for open source
